item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:17, topic:511779”]Having to initiate a bunch of options and using those events seems like it’d be annoying.[/quote]Not really… It forces you to write decent and decoupled code.

Would you really rather have this compared to the above?

[code=Java]package org.moparscape.msc.gs.npchandler;

import org.moparscape.msc.gs.Instance;
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.event.ShortEvent;
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.ChatMessage;
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.InvItem;
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.MenuHandler;
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.Npc;
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.Player;
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.World;

/**
*

  • @author xEnt

*/
public class Apothecary implements NpcHandler {

public static final World world = Instance.getWorld();

String[] names = { "Do you have a potion to make my hair fall out?",
		"I am in need of a strength potion", "No thanks" };

public void handleNpc(final Npc npc, Player player) throws Exception {
	player.setBusy(false);
	player.informOfNpcMessage(new ChatMessage(npc,
			"Hello, can i help you?", player));
	Instance.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(player) {
		public void action() {

			owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(names) {
				public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
					if (option < 0 && option > names.length)
						return;

					if (option == 0) {
						owner.informOfChatMessage(new ChatMessage(owner,
								reply, npc));
						Instance.getDelayedEventHandler().add(
								new ShortEvent(owner) {
									public void action() {
										owner.informOfNpcMessage(new ChatMessage(
												npc,
												"Here you are, enjoy this",
												owner));
										Instance.getDelayedEventHandler()
												.add(new ShortEvent(owner) {
													public void action() {
														owner.getActionSender()
																.sendMessage(
																		"Apothecary hands you a mysterious potion");
														owner.getInventory()
																.add(new InvItem(
																		58));
														owner.getActionSender()
																.sendInventory();
														owner.setBusy(false);
														npc.setBusy(false);
														npc.unblock();
														return;
													}
												});
									}
								});

					} else if (option == 1) {

						owner.informOfChatMessage(new ChatMessage(owner,
								reply, npc));
						Instance.getDelayedEventHandler().add(
								new ShortEvent(owner) {
									public void action() {
										owner.informOfNpcMessage(new ChatMessage(
												npc,
												"Bring me a limpwurt root and a spider egg and i will make you one",
												owner));
										Instance.getDelayedEventHandler()
												.add(new ShortEvent(owner) {
													public void action() {
														String[] s = {
																"I have the ingredients",
																"Ok ill find them." };
														owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(
																s) {
															public void handleReply(
																	final int option,
																	final String reply) {
																if (option == 0) {
																	owner.informOfChatMessage(new ChatMessage(
																			owner,
																			reply,
																			npc));
																	world.getDelayedEventHandler()
																			.add(new ShortEvent(
																					owner) {
																				public void action() {
																					if (owner
																							.getInventory()
																							.countId(
																									220) < 1
																							|| owner.getInventory()
																									.countId(
																											219) < 1) {
																						owner.informOfNpcMessage(new ChatMessage(
																								npc,
																								"It seems you don't have everything i asked for, come back later.",
																								owner));
																						owner.setBusy(false);
																						npc.setBusy(false);
																						npc.unblock();
																						return;
																					} else {
																						if (owner
																								.getInventory()
																								.remove(220,
																										1) > -1
																								&& owner.getInventory()
																										.remove(219,
																												1) > -1) {
																							owner.getInventory()
																									.add(new InvItem(
																											221));
																							owner.getActionSender()
																									.sendMessage(
																											"Apothecary hands you a Strength Potion (4 dose)");
																							owner.getActionSender()
																									.sendInventory();
																							owner.setBusy(false);
																							npc.setBusy(false);
																							npc.unblock();
																							return;
																						}
																					}
																				}
																			});
																} else {
																	owner.setBusy(false);
																	npc.setBusy(false);
																	npc.unblock();
																}
															}
														});
														owner.getActionSender()
																.sendMenu(s);
													}
												});
									}
								});

					} else {
						owner.setBusy(false);
						npc.setBusy(false);
						npc.unblock();
					}

				}
			});
			owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(names);
		}
	});
}

}[/code]

I’d really like to see you explain exactly what is going on in the above, without using external knowledge about the NPC or other implementations.

item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“latifundio, post:13, topic:511779”]Quest bug out a lot for me since i always seems to forget something.

Here’s is an ex. of apothecary checking for quest stage.

[code=scala]package org.moparscape.msc.gs.npchandler
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.dialog.NpcDialog

class Apothecary extends NpcDialog {

override def init {
	this + option1
	this + option2
	this + option3
}

override def begin {
	this > "Hello, Im the Apothecary"; breath
	this > "I have potions to brew, what do you need?"; breath
	if (qstage == 4) {
		this < "Apothecary, Father Lawrence sent me"; breath
		this < "I need some Cadava potion to help Romeo and Juliet"; breath
		this > "Cadava potion. Its pretty nasty. And hard to make"; breath
		this > "Wing of Rat, Tail of frog. Ear of snake and horn of dog"; breath
		this > "I have all that, but I need some cadavaberries"; breath
		this > "You will have to find them while i get the rest ready"; breath
		this > "Bring them here when you have them. But be careful. They are nasty"; breath
		player.setQuestStage(5, 5, true)
		exit
	}
	else if (qstage == 5) {
		if (player.getInventory.contains(55)) {
			this > "Well done. You have the berries"; breath
			player.getInventory.remove(55, 1)
			player.getActionSender.sendInventory
			this >> "You hand over the berries"; pause(1500)
			this >> "Which the apothecary shakes up in vial of strange liquid"; breath
			this > "Here is what you need"; breath
			player.getInventory.add(57, 1)
			player.getActionSender.sendInventory
			this >> "The apothecary gives you a Cadava potion"; pause(1500)
			this >> "I'm meant to give this to Juliet"
			
		}
		else {
			this > "Keep searching for the berries"; breath
			this > "they are needed for the potion"; breath
		}
		end
	}	
	else end
}

lazy val option1 = new NpcDialog("Can you make a strength potion?") {

	override def begin {
		breath
		this > "Yes, You'll need to find the eggs of a deadly red spider"; breath
		this > "And a limpwurt root"; breath
		this > "Oh and you'll have to pay me 5 coins"; breath
		end
	}

	this + new GenericEnd("I have all the ingredients", npc, player) {
		override def begin {
			if (player.getInventory.remove(10, 5) 
					&& player.getInventory.remove(219, 1)
					&& player.getInventory.remove(220, 1)) {
				player.getActionSender.sendInventory; breath
				this >> "The apothecary brews up a potion"; breath
				player.getInventory.add(221, 1)
				player.getActionSender.sendInventory
				this >> "The apothecary gives you a strength potion"
			}
			else {
				breath
				this > "You still don't have everything I asked for"; pause(1500)
			}
			super.begin
		}
	}
	
	this + new GenericEnd("Ok, I'll look out for them", npc, player)
}

lazy val option2 = new Transact("Have you got any good potions to give away?",
	Array[(Int, Int)](), Array((58, 1)), Array[String](), npc, player) {
	override def success {
		this > "Only that spot cream, hope you enjoy it!"; pause(1500)
		this >> "Apothecary hands you a misterious potion"
		super.success
	}
}

lazy val option3 = new GenericEnd("Nothing thank you", npc, player)

lazy val qstage = player.getQuestStage(5)

}
[/code]

and maybe you could start tramp with this:

[code=scala]package org.moparscape.msc.gs.npchandler
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.dialog.NpcDialog

class Tramp extends NpcDialog {

override def init {
this + option1
this + option2
this + option3
//option4 shield of arrav
}

override def begin {
	this > "Spare some change guv?"; breath
	end
}

lazy val option1 = new GenericEnd("Sorry I haven't got any", npc, player)

lazy val option2 = new Transact("Ok here you go",
		Array((10, 1)), Array[(Int, Int)](), Array(".."), npc, player) {
	override def success {
		this >> "You give a coin to the tramp"; pause(1500)
		this > "Hey thanks!"
		super.success
	}
	override def fail {
		this >> "You don't have any coins"; pause(1500)
		super.fail
	}
}

lazy val option3 = new RespondEnd("Go get a job",
		Array("You startin?"), npc, player)

}
[/code][/quote]WTF are you doing? There is no player.getQuestStage… You need to do something like this:
if(player.quests.get(RomeoQuest.id).stage == 4)

Though, it would be better if you didn’t just have stages hard-coded all over and didn’t have the quest logic all spread apart. So, something like this:

[code=Scala]package org.moparscape.msc.gs.npchandler
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.dialog.NpcDialog

class Apothecary extends NpcDialog {

    override def init {
            this + option1
            this + option2
            this + option3
    }

    override def begin {
            this > "Hello, Im the Apothecary"; breath
            this > "I have potions to brew, what do you need?"; breath
            player.quests.get(RomeoQuest.id).asInstanceOf[RomeoQuest].apothercaryDialog(this)
            end
    }

    lazy val option1 = new NpcDialog("Can you make a strength potion?") {

            override def begin {
                    breath
                    this > "Yes, You'll need to find the eggs of a deadly red spider"; breath
                    this > "And a limpwurt root"; breath
                    this > "Oh and you'll have to pay me 5 coins"; breath
                    end
            }

            this + new GenericEnd("I have all the ingredients", npc, player) {
                    override def begin {
                            if (player.getInventory.remove(10, 5) 
                                            && player.getInventory.remove(219, 1)
                                            && player.getInventory.remove(220, 1)) {
                                    player.getActionSender.sendInventory; breath
                                    this >> "The apothecary brews up a potion"; breath
                                    player.getInventory.add(221, 1)
                                    player.getActionSender.sendInventory
                                    this >> "The apothecary gives you a strength potion"
                            }
                            else {
                                    breath
                                    this > "You still don't have everything I asked for"; pause(1500)
                            }
                            super.begin
                    }
            }
            
            this + new GenericEnd("Ok, I'll look out for them", npc, player)
    }
    
    lazy val option2 = new Transact("Have you got any good potions to give away?",
            Array[(Int, Int)](), Array((58, 1)), Array[String](), npc, player) {
            override def success {
                    this > "Only that spot cream, hope you enjoy it!"; pause(1500)
                    this >> "Apothecary hands you a misterious potion"
                    super.success
            }
    }

    lazy val option3 = new GenericEnd("Nothing thank you", npc, player)

}[/code]

As for quests, check out these:

item.description:
@xrune wrote:

Was wondering if someone could create an interface system similar to zilents so that we can test out quests before we submit them on Github for moparclassic… We would have to write new methods though for the way moparclassic is written… id make it as simple as the one he is using though…

Interface.java:

[code]/**

  • This class gives a ‘preview’ into the code that you are developing.
  • @author Zilent

*/

public class Interface implements Runnable {

/**
 * The quest ID associated with this object
 */

private int questID = -1;

/**
 * A flag to ensure that no null quests shall be advanced in stage
 */

private boolean questStarted = false;

/**
 * Constructs a new non-quest-related Interface object
 * <br>
 * Please note - No quest-related methods may be called with this constructor
 */

public Interface() {}

/** 
 * Constructs a new quest-related Interface object
 * @param player The player associated with this object
 * @param npc The NPC associated with this object
 * @param questID The quest ID that is associated with this object
 */

public Interface(int questID) {
	this.questID = questID;
}

/**
 * This method is overridden in each of the Interface extensions that you create
 * It acts as the entry point into the npc interaction
 */

public void run(){}

/**
 * Sends a series of chat messages from a NPC to a Player
 * <br>
 * Keep in mind, that the NPC AI's interpretation engine may be affected (Eve Of Cultus Only)
 * @param text The list of text that the NPC should say
 */

public void npcTalk(String[] text) {
	for(int index = 0; index < text.length; index++) {
		System.out.println("NPC: " + text[index]);
		try {Thread.sleep(2000);} catch(Exception e){}
	}
}

/**
 * Sends a medium or large black box message
 * 
 * @param msg
 *            - the message
 * @param big
 *            - true if large box, false if medium
 */
public void SendBoxMessage(String[] text , boolean big) {
	System.out.println("SendBoxMessage: " + text);
}

/**
 * Sends a large black box Message to the player
 * 
 * @param msg
 *            - the message
 */
public void SendBoxMessage(String[] text) {
	System.out.println("SendBoxMessage: " + text);
}

/**
 * Sends a chat message from a NPC to a Player
 * <br>
 * Keep in mind, that the NPC AI's interpretation engine may be affected (Eve Of Cultus Only)
 * @param text The text that the NPC should say
 */

public void npcTalk(String text) {
	System.out.println("NPC: " + text);
	try {Thread.sleep(2000);} catch(Exception e){}
}

/**
 * Sends a series of chat messages from the Player to the NPC
 * <br>
 * Keep in mind, that the NPC AI's interpretation engine may be affected (Eve Of Cultus Only)
 * @param text The list of text that the Player should say
 */

public void playerTalk(String[] text) {
	for(int index = 0; index < text.length; index++) {
		System.out.println("Player: " + text[index]);
		try {Thread.sleep(2000);} catch(Exception e){}
	}	
}

/**
 * Sends a chat message from the Player to the NPC
 * <br>
 * Keep in mind, that the NPC AI's interpretation engine may be affected (Eve Of Cultus Only)
 * @param text The text that the Player should say
 */

public void playerTalk(String text) {
	System.out.println("Player: " + text);
	try {Thread.sleep(2000);} catch(Exception e){}
}

/**
 * Sends a generic message to the player
 * @param text The text to send
 */

public void sendMessage(String text) {
	System.out.println(text);
}

/**
 * Checks whether the Player's inventory contains the amount of the ID specified
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @param itemAmount The item amount
 * Returns true if the player has the amount of the ID specified
 */

public boolean inventoryContains(int itemID, int itemAmount) {
	System.out.println();
	System.out.println("Does the player's inventory contain the item?");
	System.out.println("0 - No");
	System.out.println("1 - Yes");
	System.out.print("Enter selection: ");
	try {
		int response = System.in.read() - 48;
		while(System.in.read() != 10) {}
		return response == 0 ? false : true;
	} catch(Exception e) {
		return false;
	}
}

/**
 * Checks whether the Player's inventory contains any amount of the ID specified
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @return True if the player has any amount of the ID specified
 */

public boolean inventoryContainsID(int itemID) {
	System.out.println();
	System.out.println("Does the player's inventory contain the item?");
	System.out.println("0 - No");
	System.out.println("1 - Yes");
	System.out.print("Enter selection: ");
	try {
		int response = System.in.read() - 48;
		while(System.in.read() != 10) {}
		return response == 0 ? false : true;
	} catch(Exception e) {
		return false;
	}
}

/**
 * Adds an item to the player's inventory
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @param itemAmount The item amount
 */

public void addInventoryItem(int itemID, int itemAmount) {
	System.out.println("Adding " + itemAmount +" of " + itemID + " to player's Inventory");
}

/**
 * Removes an item from the player's inventory
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @param itemAmount The item amount
 */

public void removeInventoryItem(int itemID, int itemAmount) {
	System.out.println("Removing " + itemAmount +" of " + itemID + " to player's Inventory");
}

/**
 * Checks whether the player's bank contains the amount of the ID specified
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @param itemAmount The item amount
 * @return True if the player's bank contains the amount of the ID specified
 */

public boolean bankContains(int itemID, int itemAmount) {
	System.out.println();
	System.out.println("Is the player wielding the item?");
	System.out.println("0 - No");
	System.out.println("1 - Yes");
	System.out.print("Enter selection: ");
	try {
		int response = System.in.read() - 48;
		while(System.in.read() != 10) {}
		return response == 0 ? false : true;
	} catch(Exception e) {
		return false;
	}
}

/**
 * Checks whether the player's bank contains any amount of the ID specified
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @return True if the player's bank contains any amount of the ID specified
 */

public boolean bankContainsID(int itemID) {
	System.out.println();
	System.out.println("Does the player's bank contain the item?");
	System.out.println("0 - No");
	System.out.println("1 - Yes");
	System.out.print("Enter selection: ");
	try {
		int response = System.in.read() - 48;
		while(System.in.read() != 10) {}
		return response == 0 ? false : true;
	} catch(Exception e) {
		return false;
	}
}

/**
 * Adds an item to the player's bank
 * <br>
 * Please note: Bank Account modification affects ALL players that are linked to the current player's user
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @param itemAmount The item amount
 * @return True if the item deposit was successful
 */

public boolean addBankItem(int itemID, int itemAmount) {
	System.out.println("Adding " + itemAmount + " of item ID " + itemID + " to player's bank");
	return new java.util.Random().nextInt(2) == 0 ? true : false;
}

/**
 * Removes an item from the player's bank
 * <br>
 * Please note: Bank Account modification affects ALL players that are linked to the current player's user
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @param itemAmount The Item amount
 */

public void removeBankItem(int itemID, int itemAmount) {
	System.out.println("Removing " + itemAmount + " of item ID " + itemID + " to player's bank");
}

/**
 * Creates a log in the event of something strange happens as your code is executed
 * <br>
 * This can be used to trap players who are attempting to exploit parts of your code
 * @param message The message to log
 */
 
 public void log(String message) {
	System.out.println("Logging anomoly: " + message);
 }
 
 /**
  * Retrieves the quest stage that a player is currently on
  * @param questID The quest's unique ID
  * @return The quest's stage if the quest is started, -1 if the quest is not started
  */
  
  public int getQuestStage(int questID) {
	return -1;
  }

/**
 * Checks whether the player is wielding an item of the specified ID
 * @param itemID The item ID
 * @return True if the player is wielding an item of the specified ID
 */

public boolean isWielding(int itemID) {
	System.out.println();
	System.out.println("Is the player wielding the item?");
	System.out.println("0 - No");
	System.out.println("1 - Yes");
	System.out.print("Enter selection: ");
	try {
		int response = System.in.read() - 48;
		while(System.in.read() != 10) {}
		return response == 0 ? false : true;
	} catch(Exception e) {
		return false;
	}
}

/**
 * Teleports the player to the coordinate specified
 * <br>
 * Please note - a player may not be teleported if serving a jail sentence, or are being held by a staff member
 * @param x The X coordinate to teleport this player to
 * @param y The Y coordinate to teleport this player to
 * @param bubble Should a bubble appear when teleported?
 * @return True if the player was successfully teleported
 */

public boolean teleport(int x, int y, boolean bubble) {
	System.out.println("Attempting to teleport player to (" + x + ", " + y + ") " + (bubble ? "with " : "without ") + " a bubble");
	return new java.util.Random().nextInt(2) == 0 ? true : false;
}

/**
 * Waits for the specified time (in milliseconds) before continuing execution
 * @param time The time to wait
 */

public void wait(int time) {
	System.out.println("Waiting for " + time);
	try {Thread.sleep(time);}catch(Exception e){}
}

/**
 * Displays a menu to the player to determine the next course of action
 * @param options The choices that the player may choose
 * @return The option that the player has chosen
 */

public int showMenu(String[] options) {
	System.out.println();
	System.out.println("MENU OPTIONS");
	int index = 0;
	for(String option : options) {
		System.out.println("(" + index++ + ") " + option);
	}
	System.out.print("Enter selection: ");
	try {
		int choice = System.in.read() - 48;
		while(System.in.read() != 10) {}
		return choice;
	} catch(Exception e) {
		System.out.println("Menu Cancelled");
		return -1;
	}
}

/**
 * Attempts to advance the associated quest's stage
 * <br>
 * This method will not advance a null quest
 */

public void advanceQuestStage() {
	if(questID == -1 || !questStarted) {
		System.out.println("Invalid method call [advanceQuestStage()]");
	} else {
		System.out.println("Advancing Quest Stage");
	}
}

/**
 * Attempts to start the associated quest
 * <br>
 * This method will not start a null quest ID or start a quest that is already started
 */

public void startQuest() {
	if(questID == -1 || questStarted) {
		System.out.println("Invalid method call [startQuest()]");
	} else {
		System.out.println("Starting Quest");
		questStarted = true;
	}
}

/**
 * Attempts to retrieve the associated quest's current stage
 * @return The current stage of the associated quest, -1 if quest is null or not started
 */

public int getQuestStage() {
	if(questID == -1 || !questStarted) {
		System.out.println("Invalid method call [getQuestStage()]");
		return -1;
	} else {
		System.out.println("Retrieving Quest Stage");
		return new java.util.Random().nextInt(5);
	}
}

public void finishQuest(int questID) {
	if(questID == -1 || !questStarted) {
		System.out.println("Invalid method call [finishQuest()]");
	} else {
		System.out.println("Finishing Quest");
	}
}

}[/code]

example of a Npc java file:
Merlin.java

[code]public class Merlin extends Interface {

//Constant values that make the code easier to read and develop
private static final int QUEST_ID = 53;
private static final int QUEST_POINTS = 0;
private static final int HOUSE_X = 555;
private static final int HOUSE_Y = 555;
//End of constant values	

public static void main(String[] args) {
	new Merlin().run();
}
     
public void run() {
	playerTalk("hello");
	npcTalk("Hello, there Traveler");
	npcTalk("I see You have come from long and Far, and a future that may hold within");
	npcTalk("Come in and settle in my cozy little hut for awhile,");
	npcTalk("I'll make you some nice fresh tea, to help you with your travels");
	npcTalk("Would you like to join me then?");
	int choice = showMenu(new String[] {"Sure why not, i may as well relax my restless legs from the long travels", "No Thankyou, im real hurry to get through the Pass, and on with my journey", "Buzz off old Man!"});
	if(choice == 0) {
		sureWhyNot();
	} else if(choice == 1) {
		noThanks();
	} else if(choice == 2) {
		buzzOff();
	}
}

private void noThanks() {
	npcTalk("I see, good bye traveller");
}

private void sureWhyNot() {
	npcTalk("Ok step this Way");
	System.out.println("Merlin takes you to his house");
	teleport(HOUSE_X, HOUSE_Y, false);
	npcTalk("Ah, here we are please dont touch a thing though");
	npcTalk("As my own house is a mess currently and powerful objects are scattered about");
	npcTalk("My last traveler was not so lucky, he was turned in stone!");
		npcTalk("His name was Midas, too bad, he would have been a great king");
	npcTalk("Rumors have it, that he could turn things to gold, but only within");
 	npcTalk("The reaches of his kingdom, a spell long ago was put on him");
	npcTalk("The people of his kingdom banished the poor old fool..");			
	npcTalk("We wouldn't want to see a repeat of Midas's mistake, now would we?");
	npcTalk("Anyway, hmm.."); 
	int choice = showMenu(new String[] {"OK, i wont touch anything", "Let me see here, opps i accidently broke a canister!", "I swear I wont, you'd prolly blast me in seconds, if i did, anyhow"});
	if(choice == 0) {
		noTouchOrBlastMe();
	} else if(choice == 1) {
		oops();
	} else if(choice == 2) {
		noTouchOrBlastMe();
	}
}

private void oops() {
	npcTalk("Now you will surely pay me back for those wont you?");
	npcTalk("or ill think twice of zapping you");
	sendMessage("Merlin attempts to pull out his staff, then backs down..");
	npcTalk("NOW GET OUT OF MY HOUSE!");
}

private void noTouchOrBlastMe() {
	npcTalk("Thats very wise of you, young man");
	npcTalk("I wanted to talk to you about a a task needing to be done,");
	npcTalk("I want you to try and reveal your true self by extracting the excalibur,");
	npcTalk("only then, will the Sword of Power be revealed and the next king appointed");
	npcTalk("Without a new king, especially in the hands of the current king,");
	npcTalk("are lands and homes will surely fall!");
	npcTalk("Small rebel groups are already beginning to form, to overthrow the current king");
	npcTalk("unless the worthy one who extracts the sword from the stone is proclaimed!");
	npcTalk("What do you say?");
	int choice = showMenu(new String[] {"Yes Merlin, i see the danger of this city and lands governed under a new tyrant, ill surely help!", "No Sorry, nice chatting with you now i really must be going", "Maybe the next time, i come around these parts sorry"});
	if(choice == 0) {
		seeDanger();
	} else if(choice == 1) {
		noSorry();
	} else if(choice == 2) {
		maybeNextTime();
	}
}

private void maybeNextTime() {
	npcTalk("Ok you know where to find me");
}

private void noSorry() {
	npcTalk("Alright see you next time traveler! Help is greatly needed!");
}

private void seeDanger() {
	npcTalk("Ok, Great! Near the Castle of Tantegel, in a small town named Avalon,");
	npcTalk("you should see a sword stuck in stone");
	npcTalk("You should see the small city just north of here...");
	npcTalk("and report back to me when you've retrieved it");
	npcTalk("Good Luck Travler!");
}

private void buzzOff() {
	sendMessage("The Wizard Pulls out his staff, but thinks twice of zapping you,");
	sendMessage("because you seem to look weary and tired from the journey");
}

}
[/code]
